So a quick check around the forums would show a few differing view points on how to vengance tank.

Honestly I suspect all of them work and what we are arguing over is which is "best".The setups that I have ended up using are.Raid tanking - Haste/mastery - Fallout, Felblade, Feed the Demon, Soul Barrier.General aim being here to maximise demon spikes uptime.M+ - Crit/mastery - Burning Alive, Flame Crash, Soul Rending, Last Resort This build is about aoe damage output.
We can critically heal on most of our heals and we also leech a lot of health based on our damage output.

When clearing M+ the ratio of tanks to dps is far higher than raids so if you can bump your damage it helps a tonIcy VeinsPersonally I don't like this setup but I know Smørholm considers it to be the best.Overall depending on what stats you get, what content you want to do and personal preferences there are several different ways to play Vengeance.
It's a very versatile spec that can honestly do most things given the right stats.

I'm not saying those trinkets are COMPLETELY useless, but they're definitely worse than other options, because they mean that you're putting that overall extra pressure and responsibility on healers for the benefit of having a 600k (less than a boss melee) absorb from rokmora or a very weak proc 3 or 4 times during a fight from parjesh, both of which will VERY RARELY help you, if ever.I dunno; I just cleared heroic Xavius with two tanks for the first time tonight, and the extra stamina and the clutch heal at low health from Parjesh was very useful for keeping me from death and at high enough hp to survive the dispel with a high amount of stacks (when 6 stacks tick for 1 million a second pre mitigation, the extra stamina can definitely make a difference).
Both the passive stamina and proc also further boost Metamorphosis (and as such the heal from Fueled By Pain).
I never called it BiS for farming; I said that it can be very nice to have during progression raids.
If you have it proccing at the wrong time, I'd say THAT is a sign of either you or healers failing, not the opposite.
If you drop down below 35% in the first place, the heal can rarely be wasted, unless your healers were actually not healing you at all or you failed at some mechanic while not having aggro.
Unlike a PPM trinket that can just go off at entirely the wrong time and actually end up being useless (e.g.
Chrono Shard proccing when you're not actively tanking).
I'm not sure why you even bring the Rokmora thing up; I said in the very first sentence of my paragraph about it that I was talking specifically about Mythic+, and in conjunction with Soul Barrier.
Of course a trinket reducing damage by 70k/hit won't be good against raid bosses (bar something very specific).

Lastly, the point of having an absorb shield on demand (Nightwell Essence) is not primarily to survive a random hit from a boss' melee - There are plenty of mechanics on the current raid bosses where you take a big enough hit to kill you (or do other nasty stuff) before mitigation, and every bit of further mitigation helps.

Sweetspot is around 25% haste for most bosses.things you can do to maximize the effect of Demon Spikes:- use your soul carver on CD- don't let soul fragments expire (especially those from soul carver)- don't use demon spikes while the boss is doing something else (casting/charging)Haste not only reduces cooldown but also increases Soul Fragment generation.Feed the Demon reduces a flat amount while haste reduces it by a percentage making them a very potent combination.Basically haste is stacking with itself so the more you have the stronger it actually gets (until cap).

Dungeon: 03/10/2016 10:55Posted by АаксAs for Ursoc he's definitely the most annoying boss for a tank in the entire dungeon.

Thankfully, the fight is really short.What I may suggest to you is:1) Focus the other tank and move the focus frame somewhere near yours to easily track debuffs2) You can actually learn at which points in a fight he will make the voidzone, so you can be ready to jump out.
Also if you are not tanking you can pre-emptively run out and taunt him out of the pool, because he seems to make a mess right after debuff application3) Forget your DPS.
Try to calm down and concentrate solely on your cooldowns and tank swap.
4) Don't try to conserve things like metamorphosis and fire brand, especially in the beginning of the fight, because they will be up again towards the end.Oh we downed him.
Me and other tank worked out a system and routine that worked for us.
As for concentrating on cooldowns.... >.> I was spam smashing those keys.
But its a daunting prospect knowing that any incoming dmg at any moment means your dead, and not because your bad or totally wrong.
I found that if im out by a second on using my cd's I was a gonner.Another DH tank that I follow and monitor on the 25th had a 75% perf for ank survivability.
On the 28th he managed just 30% .
On my first kill, despite always using cd's non stop I managed just 42%.I think that speaks volumes though if pre-nerf it was 75% and post nerf its dropped 45% down to 30% lol.
Really puts the fight into context for us as DH tanks.

(Sorry for the new topic, I felt it would go off topic in a lot of other threads.

Now first off I just want to say, I only levelled to 106 in the Beta to get a feel, I didn't want to spoil any further, as for PvP I played like 60 Skirmishes straight.I consider myself only better than the average joe and this is based on my personal experiences.

)Currently I've been having a blast as I'm sure most of you have too, however I've come across a few annoying problems within my brief testing.I'm sorry but what is the point of having talent choices if an option of said choices is literally needed for your class to be viable in PvP?

'Soul Rending' should be baked into the class, I mean we can already be CC'd and kited during 'Metamorphosis' to stop the healing process, which isn't a bad thing, I like the idea that you can't just pop 'Metamorphosis' and expect to face-roll everyone, because it does hit hard.. REALLY hard.At this point you may just be like "Oh, here we go again, another QQ thread..." and you're damn right, I'm sorry but...

I'd never usually make a thread like this but I dare any of you that have Beta access to try an arena without 'Soul Rending', I'm sure the top rated players could pull something out of their backside but that is another matter.Taking 'Fel Eruption' over 'Nemesis' seems to be forced if you want a ranged stun but you lose out on a lot of damage that has a huge up-time, 'Master of the Glaive' is basically a must unless you're against just melee, in which case you're giving up a reduced cooldown and free cost on your only stun.Now of course right now we currently have those people saying.. "But you have unrivalled mobility."

Hi Liradormi.
My honest advice?
don't give up.
Especially because of a few unforgiving, mentally-immature players who kicked you.
Easiest way I can describe how you can do decent damage, without typing toooo many paragraphs of every detail, is something like this... Fel Rush is your friend.
I see you're using Fel Mastery talent, great.

You want to use that pretty much all the time (but position it right so you don't aggro other mobs or fall off platforms, etc) especially after using Vengeful Retreat (go for the 2nd talent "Prepared" so that you generate Fury after using Vengeful retreat in the area of an enemy mob/boss, then Fel Rush back to it.)

Try and keep your Bloodlet DoT up with your Throw Glaives.Obviously Demon's Bite to generate Fury and then Chaos Strike like crazy, mainly on single targets, unless your artifact weapon has unlocked the 'Inner Demon' trait which will have a chance to cause some nice, free AOE damage when you Chaos Strike.
But you want to be using Chaos Strike more than anything on bosses/single target adds.
And a Blade Dance on that AOE pack of mobs, along with Eye Beam (even on bosses.)
The artifact trait which leaves a short DoT from Eye Beam, helps.
Fury of the Illidari is a really strong AOE when combined (procs/cds before using it, ofc) with CDs like Chaos Blades and a Trinket (agility increasing procs, etc.)

TL:DR Sometimes picking up a soul refreshes the duration of old stacks, sometimes it doesn't.Painbringer: Reduces all damage you take by 3% for 4 seconds.
5 stacks max.Back at launch I tested this on a dummy, and after a few tries with it, it was apparent how it worked.
The buffs could stack, and although the timer on the buff showed the duration resetting, the older stacks would fall off.

Think of each stack as its own independent buff.Here is a diagram of how it worked: http://i.imgur.com/K5hAtam.jpgRecently I saw a forum topic discussing how Painbringer worked, and a few people were saying it worked differently; picking up another soul would reset the duration of every stack.Here is a diagram of how they said it worked: http://i.imgur.com/xOfXyrR.jpgHaving not read anything in the patch notes since launch, I believed they were wrong because I had tested it myself, but decided to test it again anyway just in case.The results are: Painbringer is bugged.
~80% of the time the duration of previous stacks reset, 20% they didn't.

Sometimes it even did an odd mix where I would pick up 5 souls in 1 second increments, and the buff would go up to 5 stacks, then fall down to 3 (instead of staying at 5 or dropping down to 1).I am unsure of how the stacks are meant to behave, but I'm certain they aren't meant to work inconsistently.
The bug can result in a tank taking up to 12% less (or more, whichever way you look at it) incoming damage.

*Death’s Advance When both your unholy runes are on cooldown all movement-Imparing effects like chains of ice can’t make you go any slower than a certain speed 1 point in this talent will make you maximum go 25% slower than your normal run speed and if you have both points in this talent you can’t be slowed at all.
But roots will not have any difference on this.
Only needed for PvP *Magic Suppression each point will increase the magic damage your Magic Shell absors and increase the ruinic power you gain when getting hit.
You wont gain any ruinic power without this talent.
I’m not sure of the gain of ruinic power by each point but each point will increase magic damage absorbed by 8%/16%/25% Magic Damage is Posions, Diseases, Magic damage itself.
Can be used against most classes, but mostly used against Magic Casters.
Mage/locks/Druids/Priest/Shaman.This is only needed for PvP*Rage Of Rivandare-  this talent will increase the damage dealth by Plague Strike, Scourge Strike and Festering Strike abilities.
Each point will increase the damage by 12%/24%/36% This talent is needed for PvE and PvP*Dark Transformation – Can only be used when your ghoul have 5Stacks of Shadow Infusion.
It will remove all the stacks and give your ghoul a new buff increasing it’s current damage from 8*5=40 to 80% which will increase the damage by 100%.
And will also give it new enhanced abilities which will do more damage and better defensive abilities.
His abilities will have no effect on you.
This talent is needed for PvE and PvP *Unholy Blight – This talent will enhance your Death Coil giving it a new debuff to the enemy it’s used on.

The Death coil will deal 10% of the damage it did to the target over 10Seconds and preventing any class from being able to dispel the diseases unless they use iceblock or bubble.This will be used for PvE and can be used for PvP is not recommended using together with Resillient Infection.

*Anti-Magic Zone – This kinda works like Anti Magic Shell but you place it on the ground and it will absorb 75% of the damage it lasts for 10seconds or until it has absorbed all the damage it can absorb.
The absorb will be increased by your Attack Power, this can be used by any party or raid member inside this bubble.Will only be needed for PvP but it’s not a requirement.
*Improved Unholy Presence – This will Enhance all your presances but will be most rewarding if used with Unholy Presence.
If used with Blood Presence or Frost Presence your movement speed will be increased by 8%/15%.

And if used in Unholy Presence it will increase your Haste by 2%/5%.This is used for PvE and PvP*Ebon Plaguebringer – Your Diseases inflicts the target with Ebon plaguebringer increasing magic damage taken by 8% and increases your diseases by 15%/30% for each point spent in talent.
This is used for PvE and PvP*Sudden Doom – Every time you auto attack with your main hand you have a chance to be able to cast a free death coil with no Ruinic Power cost.
Each point will increase the chance for it to proc.

This is used for PvE and can be used for PvP*Summon Gargoyle – When used you summon a gargoyle which will deal damage to the assigned target for 30 Seconds it’s damage is increased by Attack power, It’s cast time is also decreased by having more haste.
This makes Gargoyle and Unholy Frenzy a deadly combination.
This ability costs 60Ruinic Power.This is the bottom talent in this tree, and is a must for EVERY unholy spec you make.

You should be able to do 10k dps+ even in PvP gear only, with the right specc/gemming/reforges and of course play style.
Especially with the 15% damage buff from random dungeons.
Just don't go into the ZA/ZG randoms just yet, where bad performance is much more punishing then any other HC.You're frost, so your stat priority should be str>hitcap>expcap>haste>mastery>crit.
Both DW and 2h frost is played in unholy presence now.

(Keep in mind that 5% hit and 20 something expertise is all that's needed for HCs, you don't need 8% hit and 26 exp before you start raiding).You can check my PvE specc (4/31/6) for starters (I prefer epidemic over 30s blood tap, only have to use plague strike once a minute since it overlaps with outbreak).Priorities should be to keep diseases up, spam obliterate as much as possible, frost strike when you're close to RP capped or all runes are on cooldown, and try to use KM proccs on obliterate (if you get a KM proc and it's 2s til runes are back in place for an obliterate, it's often worth to wait in stead of frost striking.)

What type of content do you focus on?Primarily PvE.

Casual PvP.I do a bit of everything, but the subject I'm feeling most passionate about is Blood Tanking in 25m HC Raids, so naturally will comment on that mainly.If PvE, what type of PvE?25m HC Raids.If PvP, what type of PvP?Casual Arena/BG/RBG when bored.What are your biggest quality-of-life issues?AOE Tanking Survivability - I'm not sure whether that goes in the QoL section, so more on that below.DRW Cost - not a big issue, could do with a bit lower.BS Cost - should be free like VB, IBF and Lichborne.What makes playing your class more fun?High Skill Cap/Making Hard Decisions - compared to the other tanks.
I always feel there's something I could've done better.
The "(Re)active Mitigation" formula is great.Being a good tank (Role.
Non-class related) is easy compared to being a good DPS, and to some extent a healer, it only requires a bit of "courage" to start, the will to learn and "lead".

Saying that, as a DK having to watch out for debuffs, plenty of CDs, maximizing survivability through efficient DS usage and gaming RE procs (Yes, you heard it right people, a bit of randomness = not boring), having to keep up Blade Barrier and make generally <hard decisions> is what keeping me interested.Recent posts worried me a bit, as it seems the general direction people are demending is dumbing down/simplification of the class.DK Tanks do have <small> issues, which can easily be fixed with a <very minor> buff rather than a complete overhaul (in this case simplification) of our great play style.Reducing Outbreak CDs, making BS "automatic" along with other changes mentioned eliminates the need for hard decisions, and is what I consider not fun.What makes playing your class less fun?AOE Tanking Survivability - our form of mitigation is inferior to block against multiple mobs.

While this is a non-issue on normal mode raids or 5m, it is a big issue on 25m HC raids, and every tier there's a certain fight where bringing a DK tank means making your raid work harder, such as Majordomo Staghelm/Nefarian adds.Slow Pace - after playing a DPS spec in Unholy presence, 1.5s GCD feels rather slow.
Would be nice to get a reduction to make everything "flow" better.Tanking in General - feels sometimes boring (the role itself, not the class).
Special assignments like Alysrazor Hatchlings, Sparks tanking on Rhyolith, Riplimb movment on Shannox, all feel interesting and refreshing.

Just feeling that currently tanks are somewhat not taking part of the challenges the DPS/Healers are required to overcome in raids.How do you feel about your “rotation”?As said in previous sections, current "casting priority" feels great and makes for hard/interesting decisions.
Would love even more spells/utility.What’s on your wish list for your class?Maintaining the current great play style that requires hard decision making.
While making it a bit faster paced.Multiple Add Tanking survivability improved.Adding more interesting spells/utility.
Spells like Shockwave, Heroic Leap, Typhoon, Holy Wrath, Leap of Faith, Charge, Any Raid-Wide CD (and I could go on) all add more depth to the class and make for even more interesting choices.
While I don't expect to get any/all of these, having something new and interesting is always fun.
Personally I always though having DG act as a charge against bosses would be nice.
;) Tanking in General - making us participate in the fight.

Making Tank DPS matter more (Like Alysrazor Hatchlings, Spark tanking).What spells do you use the least?Spells I assume are supposed to be used by Blood that I use rarely:Blood Strike - no real use for it :ODark Simulacrum - great spell, wish it had more use in Raids like on Ragnaros.

I also play BDK pvp, currently bg's while waiting for 7.1.5 changes and my friend recovering from illnes (then arena focus with this char).I use mostly this build:http://www.wowhead.com/talent-calc/death-knight/blood/c3NMhttp://www.wowhead.com/honor-calc/death-knight/blood/J50It's focused around smaller BG's i like (Battle for Gilneas or AB) and bigger such as Alterac Valley (where I usually tank enemy boss).
And I don't expect to kill anyone, but I tend to focus enemy healers, put some pressure on them and disrupt their healing attempts.
And for that I require more survi than most, for if enemy sees their healer being peeled, they would switch to me.
And as we (tanks) take 25% more damage from players, all those glacial spikes, chaos bolts, and retri "allahu ackbar" wrath hit pretty hard.

;) Holding position and calling for help when your team is away at another objective also requires you to survive.For Bg's such as EotS, I usually leave flag to more mobile classes (DH excel in this role), but hold the choke points to not let enemy get to the flag / our healers.In SotA now it's mostly holding choke points (like destroyed gates) while on defence, because of Murderous Intent powerful nerf.
:/As for my talent chocies...I like Blooddrinker; it's not most powerful spell when in instanced pvp (and can be interrupted...), but it's good against low health / slowed target.
You don't have to keep los after using it, so you may pillar hug or run away, etc.
Or even kite if combined with Death's Caress and DnD (yeah, kiting as a Blood, lol).You can also use defensive abilities while channeling, and strangely enough, Blood Mirror is considered one.
Tremble before me is too random, and targets may run away before it procs.

And fear may be broken by damage, I don't like that.With Tightening Grasp I can sometimes counter pillar hugging - throw DnD at one side, then Wraith Walk from another - enemy will stuck in DnD or at you.
Win-win for you.Antimagic Barrier + Will of the Necropolis + Softened Blows... it's mostly been chosen to mitigate the nerf.
:/ But it's also good for comebacks, especially when enemy blows most of his long-time cd's.
I still struggle between Decomposing or Heartstop Auras.
If you have any tip or comment on that one, I would gladly hear it.

:)Just like Necrofenix (great name, btw) said, Blood Mirror is great against monks / rogues, and would probably cause a paradox when attacking Guardian Druid utilizing Rage of the Sleeper at the same time.
I like to be in control.
The less randomness, the better.Dark Simulacrum is the best DK troll spell ever.
I love it, but it's skill-heavy.
Timing and knowing enemy class is crucial.
Duplicating Blink means mage won't run, with Regrowths you can help your teammates, Power Word: Shield or Fear also helps.
And it's very good against paladins, for if you duplicate stunning Hammer while your IBF is up, you get a 20RP cost stun.

:) And you can replicate a Bubble, and I don't need to say how good is that.As a bit of curiosity it's worth noticing you can duplicate enemy Unholy DK's Gargoyle strike or AV boss Stun (whick is mostly useless as he is immune, but works wonders when Alliance come to help).

We beat it this weekend, thanks all for the great feedback!To help out other DKs i'll contribute too:The adds are stressful to pickup, but they don't hurt a lot if one run out.
The important is to pick them at one side and get aggro on those, then you pick the other side... don't worry if they hit a healer for a bit.
A good hunter/rogue will help you with the adds, since the dps on boss during this phase is not crucial.
misdirects and frost traps help a lot.Concerning survivability, the most important thing is to only release the 7,8 and 9th add at the last summon...
This means interrupting 1 in 1st vial, all in green vial and 1 in 1st vial again.
The less time you have 9 adds the better.

then kite them (frost ring and frost field) and use cooldowns after u get 9. pretty simple...It just sucks that you have to worry with blood shield on top of all this... with next patch to blood plague this will be a bit harder to do, since you don't just spread it as easily with 1 button :S

So it seems like the Frost Artifacts in Legion aren't getting that much love at the moment, even though they're such iconic blades (Forged from the shards of Frostmourne}, their passive unlock Crystalline swords is a, albeit cool looking, icicles knock off and Sindragosa's fury while a nice concept doesn't really seem to fit or play that well, 5 min cooldown, frost breath aoe, done (Also it should be "Summon Frostwyrm").

I mean these are the blades with the essence of the Lich King still lingering within them, and there's a key word -Lich-.Ever since Warcraft 3 where I was first exposed to the realms of Azeroth and its villians, I've always admired the Lich, skeletal mages, masters of Necromancy and Ice, their power emanating from them in a aura of frigid despair.

Even starting out as a DK in Wotlk I was instructed by Amal'thazad a Arch-Lich.Now I know it's abit late to coming up with ideas since the Legion Launch is around the corner, but I've been mulling over this idea for a different approach to some of the Artifacts active abilities, to potentially replace Cystalline swords and Sidragosa's fury.Lich Form: Embrace the power within the Blades of the Fallen prince, temporarily becoming a Lich, removing the cooldown from chains of ice and transforming some of your abilities into more powerful forms.
5 min cooldown, (x) duration.Frost strike transforms to: Frost bolt volley, same damage, hits 3 targets, applies Brittle debuff to the target.
30 yrd range.
Brittle targets take 2% increased critical damage from your Obliterate or Shadowfrost Bolt.
Stacking up to 10 times.

Lasts for 4 secondsObliterate transforms to: Shadowfrost Bolt, deals slightly increased damage but split as shadowfrost, still benefits from killing machine, triggers brittle.That's the jist of it anyway, I think it's a nice concept, fits the frost DK fantasy and adds a nice new dynamic to combat.
I'd love to hear folks thoughts on this, as it's something I'd really love the devs to atleast take a glance at.

It's a tanking spec if you are not tanking then dont use it, it's as simple as that.there is no set rotation for tanking mobs or in boss fights as it's situational.

For mob tanking its Outbreak(this puts frost fever/blood plague) on target, pestilence to spread diseases (you can also use death and decay/blood boil for added threat).Main threat dealers are heart strike and rune strike, death strike is our main skill as it heals us for a certain amount and gives us a blood shield that absorbs physical damage for a percentage of the amount we heal (this is based on mastery rating) .

It works in the way the harder the boss/mob hits us we heal ourselves for more hence giving a bigger blood shieldSeriously if you want to learn about blood tanking use the elitistjerks website, it's not always correct but it is a good starting point.Please do not try to dps in blood spec as you'll only make yourself and deathknights in general look stupid, and if you dps in blood presence you'll only piss off the tank.

I've been thinking about my time as an Unholy Death Knight on my main, in which I've learned to DPS like crazy and do massive damage by combining all my skills.Though I've thoroughly enjoyed it so far, I do have a few ideas to improve it.I've seen a lot of requests for things like sub-specs to add more variation to classes, and I thought I'd throw in my suggestion for my preferred class / spec, similar to how Engineers for example can specialize in either Gnomish or Goblin.

I know they're a profession, not a spec, but you see where I'm going with this.When I reached 100, I was presented with my choice of talents; I always considered Unholy to essentially be "Pestilence", spreading disease and raising the dead.

So naturally I went with Necrotic Plague, because I felt while Blood Plague & Frost Fever were nice, it would be more suitable to have a disease that relied on Unholy runes.The tradeoff didn't really impress me, though.
First of all I noticed the obvious DPS loss, even though it does give you more AOE ability with the spreading, and gets slightly offset by Plaguebearer.

But I just think this is taking away from what this spec is supposed to be about.==So here are my suggestions for a pair of sub-specs that could be chosen at lv.100, specifically for the Unholy Death Knight:[Pestilence]Removes the Raise Dead, Army Of The Dead and Control Undead skills, forcing the player to rely on themselves.Allows the death knight to use all three diseases: Blood Plague, Frost Fever and Necrotic Plague.

These would either apply randomly via Scourge Strike or Outbreak, or could be applied by having Unholy Blight as a separate skill rather than a talent.Plaguebearer would now stack Blood Plague & Frost Fever in the same way as Necrotic Plague.Infecting skills like Death Strike would apply the same way as before.

[Necromancer]Removes all disease-based skills.Summoned ghouls have increased damage output.Army Of The Dead lasts 2 minutes instead of 40 seconds.Melee skills maintain their elemental damage, but now have slightly higher crit chance.Control Undead can now be applied on two targets.==Switching sub-specs would be done via the Unholy trainer in the Ebon Hold.I feel these would be a great addition to the game, adding more variation and better suiting the Unholy Death Knight's image / theme.

Hello,Id like to start by saying that Im really bad at composing a long line of text, so im gonna try to keep it as constructive as possible, Ive been playing Blood DK for the past 4+ years, never have I even though about switching class, because they day I stop playing DK is the day I stop playing wow, I always had all classes which have tank spec on max level, so I could compare blood to them, I never felt so weak like I am right now, bellow I will try to say why and what I would like to change, keep in mind that Im no mathematical genius and this is just opinion of then hc, now semi hc raider and someone, who is really passionate about DKs.-Out mastery is lackluster, every expansion we were either set on big selfheals, or big absorb shields, in Legion it feels like they tried to get a bit of both and it ended as both being bad-Consumption is the most underwhelming Artifact ability all tanks currently have, in most raiding scenarios it heals less then death strike and the best way of handling it is just to use it on cooldown for the dps, absolutely needs rework-Bone shield looks like a good idea on paper untill you get into bossfights like Cenarius, where keeping your boneshields up and also actually generating runic power for self heals seems nearly impossible and I end up shouting for specific externals nearly every moment my vamp blood or DRW is off cooldown -Out talent choice is extremely limited, for a raid or dungeon environment, only possible switches for talents you could make is Bonestorm/Purgatory and Possibly Rune Tap/Foul Bulwark-Our cooldown choice is underwhelming, remember back in the days where the good DK was the one who knew which cooldown to press when ?
Now we dont have any choice at all.
Some bosses cant even be parried and overall DRW is just RNG based parry chance, Vampiric Blood is good and so is AMS, but is that enough ?
Why isnt Rune Tap baseline ?

-In higher end mythic dungeons, for example Smashspite on mythic 10+ just oneshots us, there is no way to actually mitigate damage, even with properly rotating cooldown, this design choice feels unfaif and we shouldnt be punished for picking a specific spec.-The nerf of Gorefiends Grasp hurt us badly and wasnt necessary.
-Wraith walk is just bad and everyone who I ever asked would preffer to have the passive movement speed from Deaths Advance back + the ability itself is incredibly clunky without the glyph.

Possible solutions -Buff our mastery by a big chunk-Make Rune Tap baseline-Give DRW a mitigation effect-Give us more passive movement speed, all we do is walk, we should atleast be good at it-Mix up the talent choices so we choose them by utility, not perfomance-Put the person who came with Wraith walk into a rocket and shoot him to MarsAlso I love what you did to Unholy and Frost, Unholy is by far the most fun Ive had in ages when it comes to dps, but both of the specs scale so incredibly poorly and Death coil is underwhelming, what about giving it a stacking speed buff or something so its fun to press and make Dark Transformation off of GCD :) Make DKs great again !
